text: Highway 6 (British Columbia Highway 6) is a two-lane highway in British Columbia that is divided by the river in two partsâ€•the first part between USA border and Nelson is known as the Nelson-Nelway Highway and the second part between Vernon and South Slocan is known as the Vernon-Slocan Highway. It was opened in 1941, it had concurrent with Highway 3 and Highway 3A and the highway is about in length. Category:British Columbia provincial highways
title: British Columbia Highway 6
